Legal_Issue: Whether the applicant was entitled to formal written notification under the 1999 Policy and whether the grievance officer correctly addressed this issue
Governing_Law: Long Term Specified Period Employment Policy, 1999
Application_Facts: The applicant was given only one month's notice instead of the required five weeks based on years of service
Decision_Outcome: The Federal Court allowed the judicial review
Remedy_Requested: Proper redetermination at the final grievance level
Court_Ruling: Case remitted for reconsideration to ensure proper interpretation and application of the 1999 Policy
Claimant_Status: Applicant in a term employment non-renewal dispute
Defendant_Behavior: Failed to provide formal written notification as required; dismissed grievance without addressing notification issue
Grounds_for_Claim: Insufficient formal notification of non-renewal of term employment
Legal_Standard: Requirement of 'formal notification' under the 1999 Policy with prescribed notice periods
Assessment_Factor: Duration of notice provided vs. policy requirements
Applicable_Legislation: Long Term Specified Period Employment Policy, 1999
Procedural_Issue: Grievance officer dismissed the grievance without addressing the formal notification requirement
Review_Standard: Judicial review by the Federal Court
Legal_Provision_Cited: Long Term Specified Period Employment Policy, 1999 - formal notification requirement
Application_Basis: Years of service determining required notice period
Relief_Sought: Redetermination of the grievance with proper application of the 1999 Policy
Governing_Rule: Employees must receive formal notification of non-renewal with notice period based on length of service
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of documented formal notification as per policy
Harm_Assessment: Potential unfair treatment due to lack of procedural compliance in employment termination
Cause_Description: Non-renewal of term employment without compliant formal notification under the 1999 Policy
Legal_Provision_Violated: Long Term Specified Period Employment Policy, 1999 - failure to provide formal notification
Legal_Provision: Long Term Specified Period Employment Policy, 1999
Decision_Rationale: Procedural error by grievance officer in failing to address mandatory formal notification requirement
Legal_Standard_Applied: Interpretation and application of the 1999 Policy regarding formal notification
